title: Amazon will not host re:MARS robotics and AI conference this year
description: Amazon used re:MARS to show off its own cutting-edge technologies, including delivery drones.

title: Toyota defies skeptics as stock seals best week since 2009
description: Toyota stock posted double-digit weekly gains for only the third time in more than two decades.

title: Cryptocurrencies climb to end the week as investors digest BlackRock's bitcoin ETF plans
description: Crypto prices climbed to end the week, a day after the largest asset manager in the world jumped into the race to launch the first spot bitcoin ETF in the U.S.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla's market cap is directly tied to whether it solves autonomous driving
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk thinks the automaker's market capitalization is directly tied to whether the automaker is able to solve autonomous driving.

title: Binance France chief brushed off concerns days before police visit
description: Binance France's president David Princay dismissed U.S. regulatory action just days before French prosecutors accused the exchange of money laundering.

title: Trump lawyer who quit classified documents case withdraws from $475 million CNN defamation suit
description: Jim Trusty, who just quit Trump's team in the Mar-a-Lago classified documents case, cited "irreconcilable differences" with the ex-president in the CNN suit.

title: Reddit is in crisis as prominent moderators loudly protest the company's treatment of developers
description: Reddit moderators tell CNBC that company management has failed to engage with them in rolling out a huge price increase for developers.

title: SoftBank-backed startup Improbable outlines plan for metaverse to rival Microsoft, Meta
description: The company’s metaverse project called, MSquared, is more than a year in the making and would enable users to live, work and interact with each other virtually.

title: iRobot shares surge after UK regulator clears Amazon acquisition
description: The Competition and Markets Authority said it determined the deal would not result in "a substantial lessening of competition" in the U.K.

title: Binance to exit the Netherlands after failing to obtain regulatory approval
description: Binance said that it can no longer serve Dutch clients "as we have been unable to register as a VASP [virtual asset service provider] with the Dutch regulator.

title: Cash and carbon cuts stall UN climate talks — setting the stage for a 'huge fight' at COP28
description: Negotiators departed the United Nations campus in Bonn, Germany this week with a palpable sense of frustration.

title: Top EU official urges more countries to ban China's Huawei, ZTE from 5G networks
description: EU commissioner Thierry Breton called on more member states to remove Huawei and ZTE from their 5G networks, citing national security risks.

title: U.S. still expects Sweden's NATO ascension by July despite Turkey tensions, U.S. ambassador says
description: "Sweden has expectations. It doesn't mean that we will comply with them," Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said earlier this week.

title: Stellantis to reveal its first Europe-made affordable electric vehicle
description: Stellantis will reveal its first European-made, affordable electric car in mid-October.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Don’t fight the Fed? What’s that?
description: Markets don’t seem to be fighting the Fed anymore. They’re downright ignoring the central bank.

title: Michelin Guide adds 17 food stalls in Singapore to its Bib Gourmand list
description: In total, 79 dining establishments in the city-state were named to the list, up from 67 last year.

title: Musk is 'changing the way we think about risk': Satellite incumbent plans fightback against Starlink
description: Eutelsat CEO Eva Berneke is betting on a massive acquisition of a British firm called OneWeb to turn around the company's fortunes.

title: Once allies, Russia's mercenary boss is now in a more precarious position with Putin
description: Close followers of Russia are keeping as close eye on emerging tensions between the Kremlin and the head of Russian private military company, the Wagner Group.

title: 'A war for water': Europe sounds the alarm on water stress ahead of another extreme summer
description: Record-breaking temperatures through spring and a historic winter heatwave has taken a visible toll on the region's rivers and ski slopes.

title: Bill Gates visits China, hot on the heels of Elon Musk, with Xi meeting confirmed
description: Microsoft's co-founder Bill Gates is set to meet President Xi Jinping on Friday, a day after meeting Beijing's mayor to discuss a drug discovery partnership with China.

title: SoftBank-backed digital lender Zopa beefs up executive team with IPO-experienced CTO
description: Zopa told CNBC exclusively it has hired Peter Donlon, the former chief technology officer of online card retailer Moonpig, as its CTO.

title: Bank of Japan leaves rates unchanged, holding them at ultra low levels
description: The Bank of Japan's short-term interest rate target has been held at -0.1% since it first adopted negative rates in 2016.

title: Blinken to fly to Beijing for high-stakes diplomacy after spy balloon saga
description: Expectations for a significant recovery in the U.S.-China relationship, especially as a result of Blinken's upcoming trip, remain low.

title: China's VCs look to the Middle East for a U.S. dollar lifeline
description: Venture capitalists in China that once relied on U.S. investors are now holding court with Middle Eastern money.

title: Alibaba founder Jack Ma is 'alive' and 'happy,' top exec says after China's tech crackdown
description: There is continued interest in Alibaba founder Jack Ma's whereabouts after he and his empire were the target of an intense regulatory crackdown by China.

title: Ukraine's counteroffensive has been underwhelming so far — but it's low key for a reason
description: Kyiv's counteroffensive has gotten off to a quiet start but Kyiv is pursuing a strategy in which it is testing Russia's defenses.

title: China's economic recovery is stalling. Here's what to expect next
description: A raft of weak Chinese economic data in May has raised hopes of decisive policy intervention.
